plurals.name: delete_warning
plurals.item: WARNING: You are deleting a folder

resources.string: Time remaining till the alarm goes off:\n%s
Please make sure the alarm works properly before relying on it. It could misbehave due to system restrictions related to battery saving.
Allow instantly changing media by clicking on screen sides
Allow controlling photo brightness with vertical gestures
Allow controlling video volume and brightness with vertical gestures

A simple tool usable for viewing photos and videos. Items can be sorted by date, size, name both ascending or descending, photos can be zoomed in. Media files are shown in multiple columns depending on the size of the display, you can change the column count by pinch gestures. They can be renamed, shared, deleted, copied, moved. Images can also be cropped, rotated, flipped or set as Wallpaper directly from the app.
The Gallery is also offered for third party usage for previewing images / videos, adding attachments at email clients etc. It\'s perfect for everyday usage.
The fingerprint permission is needed for locking either hidden item visibility, or the whole app.
Contains no ads or unnecessary permissions. It is fully opensource, provides customizable colors.
This app is just one piece of a bigger series of apps. You can find the rest of them at https://www.simplemobiletools.com

You seem to have the app installed on an SD card, that makes the app widgets unavailable. You won\'t even see them on the list of available widgets. It is a system limitation, so if you want to use the widgets, you have to move the app back on the internal storage.
A gallery for viewing photos and videos without ads.
Apply colors to all Simple Apps
Are you sure you want to delete this item?

string.name: dialog_button_open_help_center

string.name: dialog_message_incompatible_phone

resources.string: A Daydream-ready phone is required. Visit the Daydream Help Center for more information.

string.name: dialog_message_no_cardboard

resources.string: This application may not work properly without Google VR Services. Please install Google VR Services from the Play Store before continuing.
Do an extra check to avoid showing invalid files
Do not ask again in this session

Hello,

hope you are enjoying the app. It contains no ads, please support its development by purchasing the Simple Thank You app, it will also prevent this dialog from showing up again.

Thank you!
Send your feedback or suggestions to
Empty and disable the Recycle Bin
Are you sure you want to empty the Recycle Bin? The files will be permanently lost.

This will exclude the selection together with its subfolders from Simple Gallery only. You can manage excluded folders in Settings.

Excluding folders will make them together with their subfolders hidden just in Simple Gallery, they will still be visible in other applications.\n\nIf you want to hide them from other apps too, use the Hide function.

Copyright 2014 Google, Inc. All rights reserved.

Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.You may obtain a copy of the License at

Yes, you can crop images in the editor, by dragging the image corners. You can get to the editor either by long pressing an image thumbnail and selecting Edit, or selecting Edit from the fullscreen view.
Can I crop images with this app?

Sure, just use the \"Group by\" menu item while at the thumbnails view. You can group files by multiple criteria, including Date Taken. If you use the \"Show all folders content\" function you can group them by folders too.
Can I somehow group media file thumbnails?
It is most likely caused by the files being copied from somewhere. You can fix it by selecting the file thumbnails and selecting \"Fix Date Taken value\".
Sorting by Date Taken doesn\'t seem to work properly, how can I fix it?

First you have to find the currently default gallery in the Apps section of your device settings, look for a button that says something like \"Open by default\", click on it, then select \"Clear defaults\". The next time you will try opening an image or video you should see an app picker, where you can select Simple Gallery and make it the default app.

It is most likely because you moved the app on an SD card. There is an Android system limitation which hides the given app widgets in that case. The only solution is to move the app back onto the Internal Storage via your device settings.
How can I make Simple Gallery the default device gallery?
How come I don\'t see this apps widget on the list of widgets?
You can solve it in 2 ways. You can either reinstall the app, or find the app in your device settings and select \"Clear data\". It will reset all your settings, it will not remove any media files.

Yes, of course. You can spread the word about the apps or give good feedback and ratings. You can also help by translating the apps in a new language, or just update some existing translations. You can find the guide at https://github.com/SimpleMobileTools/General-Discussion , or just shoot me a message at hello@simplemobiletools.com if you need help.
I locked the app with a password, but I forgot it. What can I do?
I want to support you, but I cannot donate money. Is there anything else I can do?

You can long press the desired album and select the Pin icon at the actionmenu, that will pin it to the top. You can pin multiple folders too, pinned items will be sorted by the default sorting method.
Sadly, you cannot. Files are deleted instantly after the confirmation dialog, there is no trashbin available.
How can I make an album always appear at the top?
I deleted some files by mistake, how can I recover them?
You can click on the current or max duration texts near the seekbar, that will move the video either backward, or forward.

Yep, as you drag a widget on your home screen a widget config screen appears. You will see colored squares at the bottom left corner, just press them to pick a new color. You can use the slider for adjusting the alpha too.
I don\'t like the widget colors, can I change them?

Exclude prevents displaying the folder only in Simple Gallery, while Hide works system-wise and it hides the folder from other galleries too. It works by creating an empty \".nomedia\" file in the given folder, which you can then remove with any file manager too.
If they were really deleted, you cannot. However, you can enable using a Recycle Bin instead of deleting in the app settings. That will just move the files in it instead of deleting them.
What is the difference between hiding and excluding a folder?
Can I somehow restore deleted files?

It can happen that you will see some unusual albums show up. You can easily exclude them by long pressing them and selecting Exclude. In the next dialog you can then select the parent folder, chances are it will prevent the other related albums showing up too.
Why do folders with music cover art or stickers show up?
That can have multiple reasons, but solving it is easy. Just go in Settings -> Manage Included Folders, select Plus and navigate to the required folder.
A folder with images isn\'t showing up, what can I do?

Adding a folder at the Included Folders doesn\'t automatically exclude anything. What you can do is go in Settings -> Manage Excluded Folders, exclude the root folder \"/\", then add the desired folders at Settings -> Manage Included Folders. That will make only the selected folders visible, as both excluding and including are recursive and if a folder is both excluded and included, it will show up.
What if I want just a few particular folders visible?

Yea, there is a toggle in Settings saying \"Replace deep zoomable images with better quality ones\", you can use that. It will improve the quality of the images, but they will get blurred once you try zooming in too much.
Fullscreen images have weird artifacts, can I somehow improve the quality?

Password setup successfully. Please reinstall the app in case you forget it.
Please purchase Simple Thank You to unlock this function and support the development. Thanks!
The Recycle Bin has been emptied successfully
Added an option for enabling horizontal scrolling
Added an option for automatically hiding the system UI at entering fullscreen mode
Added an indicator of folders located on SD cards\n Improved the way of rotating jpg images on the internal storage by modifying the exif tags + added autosave
Added a toggle for replacing Share with Rotate at fullscreen media
Added pattern/pin protection for showing hidden items
Added slideshow at the fullscreen view
Allow changing the screen brightness and volume at videos by vertically dragging the screen sides
Moved media type filter from Settings to the Action menu
Added a switch for disabling video gestures\n Added a switch for deleting empty folders after deleting content
Added fingerprint to hidden item protection\n Added a new List view type
Added an option to show customizable extended details over fullscreen media
Added an option to hide folder media count on the main screen
Added an option to keep last-modified field at file copy/move/rename
Added new options to use english language on non-english devices, to password protect whole app and to lock screen orientation at fullscreen view
Added optional one-finger drag zoom, disabled by default

Added a toggle for replacing deep zoomable images with better quality ones\n Added a toggle for hiding Extended details when the statusbar is hidden\n Added a toggle for switching media files by clicking on screen sides
Added toggles for disabling Pull-to-refresh and permanent Delete dialog confirmation skipping
Allow customizing the app launcher icon color
Allow filtering out RAW images separately
Allow selecting Favorite items for easy access
Allow grouping media thumbnails by some criteria\n Added a Recycle Bin enabled by default, can be disabled in Settings, or from the Bin itself
Added Panorama photo support\n Allow forcing portrait/landscape orientation at fullscreen view\n Allow customizing visible fullscreen bottom actions in the app settings
Allow pinning folders at the top
Added an image resizer to the editor\n Allow displaying images and videos from all folders together
Added a Select all button at selecting media and folders
Added an option to display images or videos only
Allow changing the column count with pinch gestures
Added more color customization options\n Your settings have been cleared, please reset them
Added an option to loop videos automatically
Allow zooming pngs and gifs\n Allow creating new folders at Copy/Move or Save as dialog destinations
Show some additional Exif data at photo properties
Allow showing the photos and videos on a map, if there are available map coordinates
Allow picking colors by hex codes
Added menu buttons for changing the column count
Added menu items for easy image rotating in fullscreen view
Implement proper folder hiding via .nomedia file\n Allow managing excluded folders in Settings
Allow setting different sorting per folder
Added an option to toggle gif animation at thumbnails

Exclude the subfolders of excluded folders too
 Added an easy way of excluding parent folders from the exclude confirmation dialog
 Added draggable scrollbars
 Allow setting a third party video player as the default
Fixed some sharing and editor issues\n Sorry for the frequent updates lately, they should be stopped now.
Added an option to use max brightness at viewing fullscreen media\n Added an option to manually include folders which contain media, but were not recognized by the app
Added an option to temporarily show hidden folders\n Added a setting for preventing thumbnail croping to square\n Added a setting for auto-rotating the screen depending on photo aspect ratio
Improved fullscreen image zooming\n Added more settings related to screen autorotating\n Split copy and move functions for ease of use
Allow setting portrait wallpapers\n Added more fields in photo Properties dialog
Added horizontal and vertical image flipping in the image editor
Allow hiding individual files by prepending filenames with a dot
Allow selecting multiple items by finger dragging\n Added an option to always use black background at fullscreen media

string.description: Text which when pressed, takes the user to the view that allows them to switch their Cardboard compatible viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=10]
string.name: switch_viewer_action

string.description: Prompt asking if the user wants to switch their Cardboard compatible viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=45]
string.name: switch_viewer_prompt

resources.string: Type in at least 2 characters to start the search.
